task.title: Configuring the server locale, date and time by using the
task.shortdesc: System administrators can configure the server locale, date, and time by using the Server Locale, Date and Time page in the .

context.p: You can configure the server locale, date, and time by using the , or by using the command line. For more information about using the command line to configure the server locale, date, and time, see .

note.p: The server locale and timezone, server date and time, and NTP server settings are configured per-appliance and are not replicated between HA pairs.

step.cmd: Go to the Server Locale, Date and Time page in one of the following ways:

choices.choice: From the Home tab, click Locale, Date and Time Settings in the Customize appliance settings pane.
From the Appliance menu, click Locale, Date and Time.

info.p: From the Server Locale and Timezone pane:

choices.choice: To set the locale and timezone of the server, complete the Server locale and Server time zone fields.

info.p: From the Network Time Protocol Servers pane:

choices.choice: To add a network time protocol server address, click the Add icon.
To delete a network time protocol server address, select the server and click the Delete icon.
To edit a network time protocol server address, select the server and click the Edit icon.
To test a network protocol server address, either add an address, or edit an address, and click Test connection.
To change the order of the network time protocol server address, select a server and click the Arrow icons.

info.p: From the Date and Time pane:

choices.choice: To manually set the date and time of the server, complete the Date and Time fields.If any network time protocol servers are configured, the Date and Time fields are disabled.

taskbody.postreq: If you experience connection issues after you set the time, restart the . You can restart the by using the imaserver stop webui and imaserver start webui commands on the command line. For more information about stopping and starting the process, see .
